description:
We still have code in the OpenStack API to work around the S3 ImageService leaking implementation details. Specifically, these methods:

 * _convert_image_id_to_hash
 * _translate_keys
 * _translate_status


We need to:

 * Determine whether this work-around code is still necessary?
 * If it is necessary, we need to fix the S3 ImageService abstraction to conform to the BaseImageService contract
 * It it's unecessary, we should just remove it
title: Fix leaky S3 ImageService abstraction

comments.content:
We still have code in the OpenStack API to work around the S3 ImageService leaking implementation details. Specifically, these methods:

 * _convert_image_id_to_hash
 * _translate_keys
 * _translate_status


We need to:

 * Determine whether this work-around code is still necessary?
 * If it is necessary, we need to fix the S3 ImageService abstraction to conform to the BaseImageService contract
 * It it's unecessary, we should just remove it
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rconradharris

comments.content:
Is there a way to link a bug to another bug?  This one is related:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/737953
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jtran

comments.content: Rick: All 3 of the above referenced functions no longer exist in the OpenStack API. As we've done quite a bit of refactoring around the image services in the last couple releases I think we can safely say this issue is closed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince
